title: Business Value Fundamentals - understanding and adding business value to projects
description: This is an interactive simulation where your goal is to advise the project team of a real-life Netguru project on how to tackle different, common challenges connected to delivering Business Value. You will have a chance to learn about or consolidate your knowledge on such topics as: Lean Canvas, Business Value and project OKRs.

cover_slide_data.heading: Business Value Fundamentals
cover_slide_data.intro: UNDERSTANDING AND ADDING BUSINESS VALUE TO PROJECTS

cover_slide_data.heading: Business Value Fundamentals
cover_slide_data.intro: UNDERSTANDING AND ADDING BUSINESS VALUE TO PROJECTS

published_attributes.title: Welcome
published_attributes.serialized_body:
Hi! We're thrilled to have you enrolled in this course!

What's in it for you?

In order to be an end-to-end digital transformation business partner to our clients, understanding and adding business value to projects has become a must-have skill for everyone in the Delivery Department.

This course is aimed at unifying the fundamental knowledge about the whole process, from the discovery phase, to full knowledge of business value and working on project OKRs.

The course will help you understand the basis of working with business value and OKRs and thanks to that:

  • you will broaden your perspective on project goals,
  • you will be able to support your project team with better understanding the business value of the project,
  • you will be able to focus more on value-based delivery,
  • it will be easier for you to set priorities for the project,
  • you will be able to support your team in setting OKRs for the project.

If you're not in the Delivery Department, we still recommend you to complete this course and understand a concept that is paramount for the business.

Click the "Continue" button below to get to know more about the course!

published_attributes.title: About the course
published_attributes.serialized_body:
This e-learning course consists of an interactive simulation and a final quiz:

  • Interactive simulation: Divided into 4 missions, this is where you will learn about a real Netguru project and key concepts connected to the business value idea. You will also have to help tackle real-life challenges that projects teams usually face.
  • Quiz: After you have finished the interactive simulation, you will have an opportunity to consolidate your knowledge via additional resources before taking the final quiz. The minimum required score is 80%.

Table of contents:

  1. Mission 1 (part 1 and 2) - Lean Canvas. Estimated time to complete: 30 min.
  2. Mission 2 - Business Value. Estimated time to complete: 20 min.
  3. Mission 3 - Objectives & Key Results. Estimated time to complete: 20 min.
  4. Mission 4 - Daily Work. Estimated time to complete: 15 min.
  5. Final quiz. Estimated time to complete: 5 min.

Estimated time to complete the whole course: 90 minutes. Click the "Continue" button below to get started! Enjoy and good luck!

published_attributes.title: Introduction
published_attributes.serialized_body:
You're on a mission to create business value. 

  1. Get to know the project.
  2. Learn how to add business value and work with project OKRs.
  3. Advise the project team how to tackle different challenges.
  4. Complete all the missions in the simulation.
  5. Collect badges on the way and become a master in business value.

Click the "Continue" button below to get started with your first mission!

blocks.text: You're on a mission to create business value.

Advise the project team how to tackle different challenges.
Complete all the missions in the simulation.
Collect badges on the way and become a master in business value.
Click the "Continue" button below to get started with your first mission!

published_attributes.title: Mission 1 (part 1 of 2) - Lean Canvas
published_attributes.serialized_body:
This is your first mission - Lean Canvas. Click the green dot in the embedded window below to get started and complete this part. If you prefer a full screen view, click the three dots below in the right corner to access the feature.

We recommend you to complete this part in one go. If you leave the Bridge app and come back to the course, you will be directed to this slide but will have to navigate in the embedded window by hand.

Estimated time to complete: 15 minutes.

Once you finish, click the "Continue" button below, at the bottom of the Bridge app.

published_attributes.title: Wrap-up and quizz
published_attributes.serialized_body:
Congrats!

After completing the simulation you should have the basic understanding of how to add business value to projects on daily basis.

If you feel that you need to refresh some parts of this course, you can do so by navigating back to the given part.

Here are some additional resources that will help you dig deeper. We encourage you to do so in order to consolidate your knowledge before you take the final quiz. Lean Canvas:

  • An Introduction to Lean Canvas
  • Business context - Lean Canvas Template

Business Value

  • Business Value Definition and Levels
  • Business Value Process

OKRs

  • Guide: Set Goals with OKRs

If you are ready, click the "Continue" button below and take the final quiz which consists of 14 questions. Once you start the quiz, you can't go back to the course part. In order to pass the quiz you will need to provide at least 80% of correct answers. You can have unlimited attempts to pass the quiz.

Estimated time to complete: 5 minutes.

Good luck!

START THE QUIZ NOW 👇

published_attributes.title: What industry is the case presented in the course from?

draft_attributes.title: What industry is the case presented in the course from?

published_attributes.title: When is the best time to conduct the lean canvas exercise?

draft_attributes.title: When is the best time to conduct the lean canvas exercise?

published_attributes.title: Who should be present during the call about lean canvas? Choose all the options that apply.

draft_attributes.title: Who should be present during the call about lean canvas? Choose all the options that apply.

published_attributes.title: If the team is not eager to fill the lean canvas template, the Project Manager should fill it themselves.

draft_attributes.title: If the team is not eager to fill the lean canvas template, the Project Manager should fill it themselves.

answers.body: Threat that the team won’t deliver the scope.
Explain the value behind the meeting and how it can positively affect the team.
Show the client the positive impact of the call and explain what the negative effects of not understanding the value can be.

published_attributes.title: You propose a lean canvas meeting to the client but they are reluctant to take part in it. How can you convince the client to join?

answers.body: Threat that the team won’t deliver the scope.
Explain the value behind the meeting and how it can positively affect the team.
Show the client the positive impact of the call and explain what the negative effects of not understanding the value can be.

draft_attributes.title: You propose a lean canvas meeting to the client but they are reluctant to take part in it. How can you convince the client to join?

answers.body: Understanding what is the primary value of the project/product delivered and its impact on the environment.
A specific, measurable goal that benchmarks how we get to the objective.

published_attributes.title: Which of the following is a definition of business value?

answers.body: Understanding what is the primary value of the project/product delivered and its impact on the environment.
A specific, measurable goal that benchmarks how we get to the objective.

draft_attributes.title: Which of the following is a definition of business value?

answers.body: Just do what the client says. It’s their product and their choice.
Tell the client that you are not going to deliver what they ask for, as it’s against the business value.
Open a discussion with the client and discuss if the priorities are right, if something changes and how it's connected to the business value you agreed on.

published_attributes.title: The client agrees with the business value, but starts to act against it, setting opposite priorities. What should the team do?

answers.body: Just do what the client says. It’s their product and their choice.
Tell the client that you are not going to deliver what they ask for, as it’s against the business value.
Open a discussion with the client and discuss if the priorities are right, if something changes and how it's connected to the business value you agreed on.

draft_attributes.title: The client agrees with the business value, but starts to act against it, setting opposite priorities. What should the team do?

answers.body: Nothing should be done. Business Value is set and it should stay that way.
Meet with your client to understand the current situation and if necessary introduce proper changes to the Business Value and the priorities.
Ask the client to prepare a new Business Value based on the current changes in the business.

published_attributes.title: There is a sudden, major change in the client's business situation – they lost a big investor. How should business value topics be addressed in such a situation?

answers.body: Nothing should be done. Business Value is set and it should stay that way.
Meet with your client to understand the current situation and if necessary introduce proper changes to the Business Value and the priorities.
Ask the client to prepare a new Business Value based on the current changes in the business.

draft_attributes.title: There is a sudden, major change in the client's business situation – they lost a big investor. How should business value topics be addressed in such a situation?

answers.body: Nowhere, OKRs don't have to be tracked

published_attributes.title: You want to check what the progress of your project OKRs is. Where would you look?

answers.body: Nowhere, OKRs don't have to be tracked

draft_attributes.title: You want to check what the progress of your project OKRs is. Where would you look?

answers.body: For the time that suits the team and is aligned with project milestones.

published_attributes.title: For what period of time should OKRs be set?

answers.body: For the time that suits the team and is aligned with project milestones.

draft_attributes.title: For what period of time should OKRs be set?

published_attributes.title: The whole team is responsible for delivering the OKRs?

draft_attributes.title: The whole team is responsible for delivering the OKRs?

published_attributes.title: Organize chronologically

draft_attributes.title: Organize chronologically

answers.body: Work on the Objective as it was, even if it can't be delivered.

published_attributes.title: The team knows that a given Objective can’t be delivered. What should they do?

answers.body: Work on the Objective as it was, even if it can't be delivered.

draft_attributes.title: The team knows that a given Objective can’t be delivered. What should they do?

published_attributes.title: Which meetings are the best to validate the tasks vs. the OKRs and Business Value?

draft_attributes.title: Which meetings are the best to validate the tasks vs. the OKRs and Business Value?

published_attributes.title: Congratulations
published_attributes.serialized_body:

Click the "Complete" button below to finish the course.
